original: JÖNSSON, Emil, Möbelhandlare, Torsby, f Fryksände 3/10 87 av lantbr J Nilsson o h h Kerstin, gm Eufemia Jönsson. Kristinehamns prakt sk, tekn avd. Anst Bröd Eriksson Arvika 06—07, Flintas Fabr Hedemora 08—09, Karlstads Snickerifabr 10, Notnäs Ångsågs Snick.fabr 11—20. Inneh eg möbelaff o be-gravn.byrå Torsby und fma Emil Jönsson sed. 20. Resor: Danm, Norge. Hdlsfrns i Arvika SM f gesällprov i möbeltillv. Hobbies: Bil-, cykel- o skidsport.
translated: JÖNSSON, Emil, Furniture Dealer, Torsby, born on October 3, 1887 in Fryksände. Son of farmer J. Nilsson and his wife Kerstin. Married to Eufemia Jönsson. Attended Kristinehamn Practical School, Technical Department. Employed at Bröd Eriksson in Arvika from 1906 to 1907, Flintas Factory in Hedemora from 1908 to 1909, Karlstads Snickerifabr in 1910, and Notnäs Ångsågs Snick.fabr from 1911 to 1920. Currently owns a furniture store and undertaker's office in Torsby, operating since 1920 under the name Emil Jönsson. Traveled to Denmark and Norway. Received a trade certificate in furniture manufacturing in Arvika. Hobbies include cars, bicycles, and skiing.

structured.name: Emil Jönsson
structured.description: Emil Jönsson is a Swedish furniture dealer born on October 3, 1887 in Fryksände. He is the son of farmer J. Nilsson and Kerstin. Emil is married to Eufemia Jönsson. He attended Kristinehamn Practical School, Technical Department. Emil has worked at various organizations including Bröd Eriksson in Arvika from 1906 to 1907, Flintas Factory in Hedemora from 1908 to 1909, Karlstads Snickerifabr in 1910, and Notnäs Ångsågs Snick.fabr from 1911 to 1920. Since 1920, Emil has owned a furniture store and undertaker's office in Torsby carrying his name. He has traveled to Denmark and Norway. Emil received a trade certificate in furniture manufacturing in Arvika. His hobbies include car sports, cycling, and skiing.
